title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
summary: Roasted Brussels Sprouts is a pescatarian recipe with 8 servings. For $1.09 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 111 calories, 4g of protein, and 3g of fat. 1 person found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. It works well as a side dish. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for Christmas. Head to the store and pick up garlic clove, rice cereal such as rice krispies, sugar, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 52%. This score is good. Try Kittencal's Roasted Brussels/Brussels Sprouts, Cheesy Fried Polenta w/Pan Roasted Balsamic Brussels Sprouts + Roasted Garlic Sage Oil, and Roasted Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                        Roast brussels sprouts:                Preheat oven to 450°F with rack in upper third.                                                                Toss Brussels sprouts with oil, then arrange, cut sides down, in a 17- by 12-inch shallow baking pan. Roast, without turning, until outer leaves are tender and very dark brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Add butter and toss to coat.                                                            Make dressing:                Stir together all dressing ingredients until sugar has dissolved.                                                            Make puffed rice while sprouts roast:                Cook cereal, oil, and shichimi togarashi in a small skillet over medium heat, shaking skillet and stirring, until rice is coated and begins to turn golden, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cool, stirring occasionally.                                                            Finish dish:                Put Brussels sprouts in a serving bowl, then toss with just enough dressing to coat. Sprinkle with puffed rice and serve remaining dressing on the side.                                                Cooks' notes:            ·Puffed rice can be made 3 days ahead and kept in an airtight container at room temperature. ·Dressing, without mint and cilantro, can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered. Bring to room temperature and add herbs before using.·Brussels sprouts can be roasted 4 hours ahead. Chill, uncovered, until cool, then cover. Reheat, uncovered, in a 350°F oven until hot, 10 to 15 minutes.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 450°F with rack in upper third.
Toss Brussels sprouts with oil, then arrange, cut sides down, in a 17- by 12-inch shallow baking pan. Roast, without turning, until outer leaves are tender and very dark brown, 40 to 45 minutes.
Add butter and toss to coat.
Stir together all dressing ingredients until sugar has dissolved.

analyzedInstructions.name: Make puffed rice while sprouts roast

steps.step: Cook cereal, oil, and shichimi togarashi in a small skillet over medium heat, shaking skillet and stirring, until rice is coated and begins to turn golden, about 3 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and cool, stirring occasionally.
Put Brussels sprouts in a serving bowl, then toss with just enough dressing to coat.
Sprinkle with puffed rice and serve remaining dressing on the side.

·Puffed rice can be made 3 days ahead and kept in an airtight container at room temperature. ·Dressing, without mint and cilantro, can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered. Bring to room temperature and add herbs before using.·Brussels sprouts can be roasted 4 hours ahead. Chill, uncovered, until cool, then cover. Reheat, uncovered, in a 350°F oven until hot, 10 to 15 minutes.
